intro: Callitriche sepulta, commonly known as the buried water-starwort, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Callitrichaceae. It is native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere and typically grows in shallow, still or slow-moving freshwater habitats. The plant has slender, branching stems that often lie close to the water surface or are partially submerged. Its small, opposite leaves are usually oval to lance-shaped and have a waxy coating. It produces tiny, greenish flowers that are clustered in umbels, typically blooming in late spring to early summer.
